On Specific Class¶

You can see very self-explanatory syntaxes in classes. For those explicit names, explanations are omitted.

Tip

For any keyword arguments name, you don’t have to explicit name it.

Tip

As you’re required to give assignment equations, you don’t have to put them in order.

class mechanics.obj(name=None, mass=1, initPos=vector(), point=True, mode='rigid', charge=False, initv=vector(), material=None)¶
Parameters:
  • mass (float) –
  • initPos (vector) –
  • point (bool) – is it a mass point?
  • mode (str) – determine how will Phyco process it in a sim
  • charge (float) –
  • initv (vector) –
  • material (material) – Under Construction
class sim.sim(objs, name=None, step=10 ** -2, field=None, const=None, tol=10 ** -3)¶
Parameters:
  • step (float) –
  • field (iterable) – field definitions field in iterable
  • const (iterable) – constraint eqn s in iterable
  • tol (float) – collision detection tolerance
class sim.event(name=None, obj, *arg)¶
